name: Batcat
wikiSummary: The Batcat EP begins with a pair of non-album cuts: there’s “Batcat”, of course, plus the unfortunately titled “Stupid Prick Gets Chased by the Police and Loses His Slut Girlfriend”. But it’s the closer, “Devil Rides”, that really fascinates, as it sports vocal contributions from freakout legend/13th Floor Elevators frontman Roky Erickson. It’s due on CD, 12″ and digitally September 8 in the UK and on 12″ and digitally (not on CD) September 9 in the U.S.
wikiText:
The Batcat EP begins with a pair of non-album cuts: there’s “Batcat”, of course, plus the unfortunately titled “Stupid Prick Gets Chased by the Police and Loses His Slut Girlfriend”. But it’s the closer, “Devil Rides”, that really fascinates, as it sports vocal contributions from freakout legend/13th Floor Elevators frontman Roky Erickson. It’s due on CD, 12″ and digitally September 8 in the UK and on 12″ and digitally (not on CD) September 9 in the U.S.
